title: Friday 8 March 2024 At 12:00 in Propylaia we flood the roads of Athens against Pierrakaki!
content:
'They find them they don't find them,

In the House building,

the only 'opposition'

WE ARE"!


The consultation-lean ended. On Friday, March 8, the government with the US and EU guidelines violently brings the Pierrakakis bill to vote in Parliament. They tremble the voice of the tens of thousands of students on the streets and the educational world that requires the withdrawal of the bill. The entire system of rotten and corruption, barbarism and dependency, government representatives and parrots of the media have fallen with rage on the students. With matte and prosecutors, with tele-extensions and black propaganda want to impose an Let's a black bill that opens the way - through the establishment of private universities and the bypass of Article 16 - to dismantle public free education and democratic freedoms. Which enters Article 58 for the first time in public universities on the pretext that foreign students will be first concerned. Which creates two -speed candidates in nationwide exams depending on the height of their wallet, competing for private schools with half a molecule. A bill that takes off class discrimination in education by throwing out the children of the working people outside the schools. They will find us in front of them!

March 8, 2007 - March 8th 2024…

… We were thrown into the glove! We will rise again!

March 8, as a voting day in the House, not only was not accidentally chosen by the government, but it shows the deep hatred of a system that wants to take the rematch from the youth. In 2007, the magnificent march on March 8, with tens of thousands of students on the streets on the day of the then Giannakos law, was a highlight of the 2006-2007 movement that hurt them deeply. A movement that blocked the revision of Article 16 and managed to prevent class barriers planning to put so many governments. A movement that has earned a time credit to free studies for many more generations of admissions to date.

Now, 17 years later, the government with a move of strong symbolism throws the glove again to the students. We are back in and respond to the streets: "PARON"!

THE NEW GENERATION DOES NOT BREAKING THE HEAD - DON'T SUPPORT!

We continue dynamically, escalating our struggle with new rounds of general assemblies, occupations and demonstrations on Thursday, March 7th and with a nationwide rally in Athens on Friday, March 8th. We do not stop even if the government passes the bill to Parliament. The student movement can even be voted on by laws. He proved it in 1979 against Law 815. Against enemies and fake friends who accept the tele-catastrophe and see March 8 as the "end", we see with the "beginning" that has been doing our big one for two months. movement. We are fighting until victory!

Neither on paper, nor anywhere! PARTY FOR THE RECEIVING OF PERAKAKI BIEWARD

NO IN THE ARTICLE REVIEW 16

PUBLIC FREE EDUCATION FOR ALL
author: ΣΤΕΦΑΝΟΣ
